conclusion: Determine the time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B with velocity inversely proportional to displacement.
Velocity v is inversely proportional to displacement x, expressed as v = k/x.
Determine constant k using v_B = 2 m/s and x_B = 2 m, resulting in k = 4.
Find displacement at point A using v_A = 4 m/s, resulting in x_A = 1 m.
Set up the integral for time t from x_A to x_B as t = ∫(1/v(x)) dx = ∫(x/4) dx from 1 to 2.
Evaluate the integral to find t = 0.375 seconds.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 0.375 seconds.
